meanings.definition: To make a charge in return.
meanings.sent1: She countercharged her opponent in the debate.
meanings.sent2: The knight countercharged the enemy forces.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully countercharged each other with pillow fights.
meanings.sent4: His determination countercharged his fatigue, propelling him forward.
meanings.sent5: The sudden rain countercharged our plans for a picnic.

meanings.sent1: He countercharged his coworker of spreading false rumors.
meanings.sent2: The defendant countercharged the plaintiff with defamation.
meanings.sent3: The friends jokingly countercharged each other of stealing snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her anger countercharged her initial hesitation to speak up.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look countercharged the students into silence.
